vulnerability.title: Enable authselect
vulnerability.description: Configure user authentication setup to use the authselect tool. If authselect profile is selected, the rule will enable the profile.
vulnerability.recommendation: Remediation script: # Remediation is applicable only in certain platforms if rpm --quiet -q kernel-core; then var_authselect_profile='' authselect current if test "$?" -ne 0; then if { rpm --quiet -q kernel rpm-ostree bootc && ! rpm --quiet -q openshift-kubelet && { [ -f "/run/.containerenv" ] || [ -f "/.containerenv" ]; }; }; then authselect select --force "$var_authselect_profile" else authselect select "$var_authselect_profile" fi if test "$?" -ne 0; then if rpm --quiet --verify pam; then authselect select --force "$var_authselect_profile" else echo "authselect is not used but files from the 'pam' package have been altered, so the authselect configuration won't be forced." >&2 fi fi fi else >&2 echo 'Remediation is not applicable, nothing was done' fi
